utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How may I help you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi I just want to talk about these, these times when I feel like I'm just I'm suffocating and I just can't breathe. It's pretty scary and I don't know what's going on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, certainly, um, feeling short of breath like that can be quite scary for sure. When, when do these episodes kind of happen? Are they spontaneous? Or can you think of things that you're doing when they when they come on.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? I, I don't know, it's just like. Uhm? Sometimes, like before interviews, sometimes just kind of random. Uhm, yeah. I can kind of tell when they're about to come on. Uhm? Yeah, I think. It's mostly like job interviews.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had many of those recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Job interviews?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I got I got laid off because of the pandemic and now I've been looking for jobs and it's just like it's kind of nerve wracking. But also like I don't know, I'm just worried it could be something else like it's just, yeah, it's like I really just can't breathe, it's so weird.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, it's certainly. It sounds like there's been a lot of stress recently. Certainly plenty for with the pandemic as well. And so when you get short of breath, you you said you have this, you could feel that it's coming on and how long does it last for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like 15 minutes 15, 20 minutes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Is there anything you do to help it go away?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'll just say go and lie down and close my eyes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you get shorter breath if you walk far distances or exert yourself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, no. I go out for a run every single day. Nothing happens at that time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And. Have you had a cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I kind of feel like this pressure at that time is just like yeah, someone's like pressing my chest inwards, kind of. It's hard to explain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see do you it is it um like, do you feel it in any one particular spot or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just feel like my chest is really tight and it's just it's like I can't like expand my lungs.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see and does this last around 15 minutes as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And similarly you like going for runs and stuff like that you on't ever get any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And and I know you mentioned you didn't have a cough, but have you brought up any phlegm or brought up any any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, I have not had a cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh no, OK, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That's OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you otherwise been well? Or if you had any infectious symptoms, like a runny or red eyes, runny nose or sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. None of those.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, have you had any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, but I get really sweaty when these episodes happen. Just like yeah, my face is like sweating, and my neck.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Yeah, Um, OK, and How is your weight been recently? Any weight gain or loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've gained quite a bit of weight since the pandemic started. Yeah, gained about 10 pounds.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes to your diet or appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, I've been eating quite a bit, been baking a lot at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, and have you had any abdominal pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and any urinary problems like pain or frequency?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any rashes or skin changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And, any muscle aches, body pains or joint pains or swelling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing like that, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and how's your energy been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. Well, I've been feeling a little low. Since I've been laid off just like worried about my finances and I kind of sleep all day. I'm not feeling very energetic.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How is your interest in activities been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't know, I just feel like staying at home and just being in bed all the time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you're um, have you had a low mood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and are you sleeping more than usual?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is there anything that you're feeling particularly guilty about right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How is your concentration been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, not great.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. You haven't been able to focus and have you felt like things are moving in slow motion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so have you had any thoughts of hurting or harming yourself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had depression or anxiety in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I've been diagnosed with depression.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had panic attacks before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, but do you think that's what's going on?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Potentially, it certainly can't rule out. Inorganic cause meaning something going on, otherwise just yet we might need to do some physical exam and some investigations first, but it certainly could be related to that. With all of the stressors that are going on. And so you had a low mood. Have you had any periods in your life where you felt really energetic, like you didn't need any sleep, you're really talkative, you had all the energy in the world.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I wish, no, I've never really felt that way,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any concerns with eating disorders in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And then you mentioned, even diagnosed with depression, if you had, are you have you been diagnosed with any other medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you on any medications right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I was doing pretty well. I used to have these episodes of depression when I was younger as a teenager and they kind of went away. I was on meds at that time, but I think I think it's coming back now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you haven't been on medication now for for quite awhile for years.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: For like 12 years 13 years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, what did you use that, if you can remember?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Prozac?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and did you find it helped?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah it was very helpful, was very good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. That's good. Any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and any hospitalizations or surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and can you tell me a little bit about where you're living and who you're living with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I live, I live with my girlfriend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And. Has there been anybody around that that has been sick that they have been around?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And. Are you currently sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any chance that you could be pregnant currently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you been pregnant in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you use any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any family history of heart or lung problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My grandfather had lung cancer. But that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did he smoke for a long time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, he was a big smoker.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and anybody in the family have problems with mental illness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My mom has uh depression too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Anybody in in the family have problems with substance, substance use?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, and  I think that's everything that I I wanted to ask on history today. So you been having these episodes where you get really short of breath and you get chest pain, you'll get sweaty and have what sounds like what sounds like an impending sense of doom where you kind of feel like it's coming on and it lasts for 15 minutes and not related to exercise. Were there any other symptoms or things that you've been experiencing recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's also,  I also feel like my heart's like breathing really fast.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, OK. And I does that, how long does it last for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Same time. Like everything is just sort of comes on at the same time. Just kind of goes away together.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, would you say that it comes on like kind of like at the snap of your fingers sort of thing like really quickly and then?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I can kind of tell it's gonna come on like I have a sense of it and then it just like starts. It suddenly just happens.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So you you have the heart racing, are there any other symptoms as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so, uh, we will get an ECG and  I will look at that, but I've been concerned now thinking that this might be related to anxiety or panic attacks and so, I guess that would be something that we could discuss more about in regards to like I guess previous traumas and things that and the stresses that you might be dealing with currently to help manage manage stress better.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
